page.title: 15LOCAL CHURCH-WEST NOTTINGHAM
page.content: St. Leodegarius was born in 616.St.Leodegarius Church dates back to 1127,although it has been restored several times and formerly had a spire steeple.The main walls are old and the church retains many objects of interest e.g.a Gothic doorway.Robert de Basford dedicated the church which he had built to a French saint.The church was a thatched building with no seats.Two of the bells are dated 1606 and one is much older.The largest bell bears an inscription.The floor has been raised several times and was raised half a yard in 1819.The galleries were removed about 1850.The registers commence 1561,that of marriages 1568.These have been extracted and published by Phillimore and Company.
